title: Disliking Varus's new lore doesn't make you homophobe
body: Calling people homophobic because they don't like the change and ignoring actual reasons why they don't like it makes you a bit of a dick though

replies.body:
I wanna piggyback off this thread because today has been something of a whirlwind with all the lore discussion, comments and more. Bear with me for a little bit.

It is _perfectly fine_ to dislike the new Varus lore as OP says. There's nothing wrong with hating something Riot has put out. I also want to say that it's ok to find enjoyment in the new lore for whatever reason. It came out today though so please don't try to forsake your boards/league account and die on a hill for some thing has existed for around 12 hours.

But I want to address both sides of the criticism: What OP refers to is smashing someone down on a personal level. It's a crappy thing to do and it's really not cool. Just because someone doesn't like lore that you do doesn't mean it's right for you to take this time to insult them on ANY level, be it outright flaming or by being excessively passive-aggressive to their stance. That said, I also want to take this time to talk about the other-side of the equation and a hot-topic that myself (and other mods) have been dealing with all day.

Varus being gay does not mean we need to hear thoughts on the idea of LGBT in the real world or your personal opinions on what you think of people in the LGBT category. Bear in mind, I'm not saying you need to like it. Everyone has their own hang-ups and feelings, which we all understand. What I do need to say is that someone liking the new lore doesn't make them an SJW crusader or a bastion of whatever political ideology you think they stand for.  The flipside is true too: Someone disliking the new lore does not make them some /b/ reject who wants to see everyone who isn't them exploded in a fiery cataclysm. The moment we jump to extremes is the moment this loses the point of being about the new lore and becomes a thinly veiled political bashing thread.

I and the other moderators know how strongly people can feel about this and how difficult it can be to divorce politics, personal feelings and hang-ups about these topics. Yet despite this, we have to remember that Varus is a fictional video game character owned by Riot Game(s). They're technically free to do what they wish with said character. Does that mean we always have to blindly sing their praises? Of course not. But that doesn't mean Riot putting in this type of character is a free pass to put your personal thoughts on such topics in a thread.

You can be upset at the new lore and it doesn't make you hate LGBTQ people.

You can be happy with the new lore and it doesn't make you an SJW.

Just please remember to be respectful guys. We know you guys are all capable of some amazing and insightful dicussion.

-Cap

I understand what you're saying and myself and the other mods are familiar with this type of stuff. That said, these complaints and feelings towards the lore aren't meant to be attacks. We have to be aware that Varus's old lore had him as a man who lost his wife and child to a war versus now where he is two lovers trapped in the fused body of a darkin. Regardless of how you slice it, it's a radical change and the old lore definitely had fans. (As one could see from the backlash from his microchange on the PBE)

Varus's story is/was problematic for two major reasons:

* Varus was one of the earliest champions (Season 2) and people have known his lore for years. He's an OG so he has a large and passionate fanbase.
* The story change radically changed who Varus was and injected elements that were not present at all.

And yes, Riot was well aware of this. Every company is aware when they make a story like this that they're fighting an uphill battle. You can even find some earnestly funny comments on the youtube video asking why Varus has a brother now. Despite this, all criticisms of the lore aren't homophobia and we do try to root out people who want to use the story to justify this "strong displeasure" of the story direction. The truth is that even if it's a hard pill to swallow, Riot can do whatever they want with the lore, be it something you approve or disapprove of. The nice thing is that they're at the very least open to listening to our criticism in most cases. 

We can definitely appreciate the story this has to tell, but to mark any detractor as a microaggressing homophobe really does injustice to the people who feel strongly about this topic and want old Varus back, for all his faults and "generic" lore.

There's nothing wrong per se of Varus being 2 gay lovers + a darkin. The fact it comes off of retconning Varus' family and just how poorly developed the 2 lovers were does kind of make it feel shoe-horned in for the sake of having 2 gay lovers. 

They were much better off using this 2 gay lovers + a darkin in a new champ instead of shoehorning it into Varus. They could at least shrug off the retcon blowback.

Because of this whole thing I read through Varus' old lore, and I couldn't even find anything about his family other than that he had a family and they died. In the judgement his wife is mentioned once, but only that she's dead. His son is mentioned once or twice, but only that he's learning how to use the bow and that his name is Threshan. But even then they're just illusions by the Summoners.
That doesn't come off as being very developed to me, calling it bare bones would be generous. Is there some hidden lore somewhere or is this really everything?

I'm not saying Varus' family was well developed, I'm saying that retconning his family (wife + kid) ON TOP of replacing it with two gay lovers (poorly developed + it feels shoehorned) would definitely be a good recipe for blowback. It's an instance of "if it isnt' broke, why fix it?" and the gay lovers doesn't add any real exciting new dimensions the old lore could have done. There was a post where they discussed how Varus could have worked with Varus being the dad and his son being the 2/3rds soul fighting against the darkin bow. Minor tweeks, not deletion and shoving in an LGBT character for the arbitrary sake of having one at the expense of a retconned straight character.

If Riot wants to have a canon gay couple, then they can. It's been done before. But they should do it right and make a brand new champion for it or reveal a currently "asexual" champion as gay. I personally think a brand new champion would send a stronger message than retconning a current champion's lore.

I get Riot's reasoning. They basically went "Varus' family - does it matter if it's a wife + kid or a gay lover?" and they answered "no" The problem I see is that it's really unnecessary and seems hella forced just to shoehorn in a (2/3rds) gay champion.

They retconned homosexuality into the dude who used to have a wife and kid's lore. Of course people are going to be bothered by it, they coulda made a whole new champion based on this and came up with lore for Varus that was still in line with themes present in his old lore. They should have made a new champ rather than retcon an already existing one.
I agree! I think that the argument that criticism against it is homophobic is ill intentioned and scapegoating the more meaningful discussion that could be had regarding the champion.

I'm fine with him being gay, it's just that the plot was so poorly thought out that it makes even less sense than the new Tokyo Ghoul chapters. Riot jumped at the opportunity to include the LGBT community in the game, which I respect, but they didn't take enough time to properly plan it out.

The issue isn't that Varus is gay, or that there is a gay relationship in League's lore. The problem is that they retconned established lore to turn a character with a very defined set of motivations and story purely to serve as a token gay character.  If taric or ezreal were revealed to be gay it'd be different, because they didn't have established lore that would contradict that.  Nothing is added to varus' story by making him gay. The varus changes felt forced and inorganic because it was tacked onto his name. Additionally, telling more story through cinematics is a chance to see the character's personality in full display. Get Jinxed was about Jinx's wild nature, lust for destruction, and to build hype for her release. The Curse of the Sad Mummy was about the inner torment that causes Ammumu's crying. Both of the songs for those were amazing and fit the visuals and the personalities of the characters. The music for this vid was terrible and forgetful. The music didn't say "varus, the vengeful archer who would sacrifice himself to pure evil to avenge his people" so much as it said "so we put music to a stunning visual sequence, and we made varus gay cause why not". The music could have used a more somber direction, maybe some hints of smallness as the sole defender against an onslaught of hostile warriors. A swell for victory and a quick fall as Varus realizes that his village was probably destroyed. The pace could quicken as he rushes to see what has become of his family. The music could fade, and timpani could start pulsing like a heartbeat. Cut to varus approaching the pit, tempo increasing. Staring into the seething froth of evil he plunges into the pit of corruption. music stops. screen is black. after a beat, see varus transformed, rising out of the bit with big heavy horns and drums playing menacingly as varus shoots an arrow through the noxian flag.
